title: How to Cook Puto Bumbong

steps.headline: Mix the yam powder and rice flour in a mixing bowl.
Pour water, a little at a time, while mixing.
steps.description: Continue mixing it until it becomes stiff.

steps.headline: Brush some margarine/butter on the plate.
Scoop the mixture and put it in your hands.
Form the dough into a circle.
steps.description: Roll it to make a small logs.

steps.headline: Put it in the plate.
steps.description: Avoid placing them near each other.

steps.headline: Put it in the steamer.
steps.description: Let it cook for 3 minutes or until cooked.

steps.headline: After they are cooked, roll it on the grated coconut meat.
Stack 3 Puto Bumbong at each serving or Banana Leaf.

text: Mix the yam powder and rice flour in a mixing bowl.  Pour water, a little at a time, while mixing. Continue mixing it until it becomes stiff. Brush some margarine/butter on the plate.  Scoop the mixture and put it in your hands.  Form the dough into a circle. Roll it to make a small logs. Put it in the plate. Avoid placing them near each other. Put it in the steamer. Let it cook for 3 minutes or until cooked. After they are cooked, roll it on the grated coconut meat.  Stack 3 Puto Bumbong at each serving or Banana Leaf.  Spread the brown sugar. Serve hot.
